title.narrative: Central Asia Regional Economic Cooperation (CAREC) Regional Road Project

description.narrative: The Project aims to develop strategic international highways and improve road sustainability in Uzbekistan. It will improve 131 kilometers (km) of the A-380 highway; and assist the Government in strengthening operation and maintenance of the road network in Uzbekistan.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Improved regional connectivity and an adequate, efficient, and sustainable road network in Uzbekistan

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
By 2013, number of cross-border trucks on A-380 (Daudata Custom Post) increased from 10 trucks/day (2007 baseline) to 17 trucks/day

description.narrative: Improved regional connectivity and an adequate, efficient, and sustainable road network in Uzbekistan

title.narrative: Accident rate reduced by 50% on A-380 highway from 150 accidents per year (2008 estimate)

description.narrative: Improved regional connectivity and an adequate, efficient, and sustainable road network in Uzbekistan

title.narrative: By 2013, total traffic volume of A-380 in Republic of Karakalpakstan increased from 360 vpd (2007 baseline) to 800 vpd and in Khorezm from 1,900 vpd (2007 baseline) to 3,600 vpd

description.narrative: Improved regional connectivity and an adequate, efficient, and sustainable road network in Uzbekistan

title.narrative: By 2013, capacity of Road Equipment Pool Company improved with new equipment to the level of 10 (on 1-10 scale) from the level of 5 in 2007. REPC's performance maintained at 80% operating ratio

description.narrative: Improved regional connectivity and an adequate, efficient, and sustainable road network in Uzbekistan

title.narrative: Allocation for road maintenance increased by 10% year on year from 2007 to 2013

description.narrative: Improved regional connectivity and an adequate, efficient, and sustainable road network in Uzbekistan
